gmmaker > gameGraphics

gameGraphics 

interface gameGraphics

Information, parameters and methods related to graphics.

Summary

Properties from gameGraphics

gameGraphics.camera
camera

Camera parameters, such as position, angle, scale (zoom), etc.
drawing[]
drawings

Array containing every drawing, ordered by ID. You can modify or delete drawings from here, and they will update accordingly.
1 | 2 | 3
quality

The quality option chosen by you, the one running the code, in the bonk.io settings menu.

Methods from gameGraphics

number
addShapeToDrawing(drawingId: number, shape: drawingShape)

Adds the given shape to a drawing. Any missing properties in the shape will be replaced with defaults.
void
bakeDrawing(drawingId: number, resolution: number)

Bake a drawing into a single image shape.
number
createDrawing(options: drawing)

Creates a drawing with the data given. Any missing properties will be replaced with defaults.
number[]
getScreenSize()

Get the current screen size (in GMMaker units), as a 2d vector. X axis is width, Y axis is height.

Public Properties

camera gmm.d.ts:1322 
camera: gameGraphics.camera

gameGraphics.camera

Camera parameters, such as position, angle, scale (zoom), etc.

If any of these parameters is altered, arrows that indicate the location of offscreen players will stop being shown.

drawings gmm.d.ts:1328 
drawings: drawing[]

drawing[]

Array containing every drawing, ordered by ID. You can modify or delete drawings from here, and they will update accordingly.

quality gmm.d.ts:1332 
quality: 1 | 2 | 3

1 | 2 | 3

The quality option chosen by you, the one running the code, in the bonk.io settings menu.

Quality is stored as a number: 1 is Low, 2 is Medium and 3 is High.

VERY IMPORTANT, PLEASE READ: Because it's your chosen quality, this value may be different for other people in the room, because for them, it's their chosen quality. This means you can potentially desync the game if you use it incorrectly.

In order to not desync the game, you should only use it for graphical or audio purposes (like, for example, to create certain drawings only if you have your quality set to High), and it must not modify the game state at all.

bakeDrawing gmm.d.ts:1358 
bakeDrawing(drawingId: number, resolution: number) → {void}

Bake a drawing into a single image shape.

This helps reduce lag by a lot, but the downside is that their shapes will no longer be modifiable.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
drawingId number

ID of the drawing
resolution number

Quality of the newly rendered image
Returns:
Type Description
void

getScreenSize gmm.d.ts:1366 
getScreenSize() → {number[]}

Get the current screen size (in GMMaker units), as a 2d vector. X axis is width, Y axis is height.

Read more about vectors here.

PD: The formula to calculate screen size is very simple.

  • width: 730 / game.state.physics.ppm
  • height: 500 / game.state.physics.ppm
Returns:
Type Description
number[]
